response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<CStick> it = testCStickChart.iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
  System.out.println(it.next().getEPIC());
}
<<<explanation>>>: You're creating a new iterator in every iteration of your loop. Try to just use the value of the foreach inside the loop.
Question: How to get the value of a key in a JSONObject: I have a JSONObject that contains a key called "name" and I want to get the value of that key. I have tried using the following code:

JSONObject jsonObject = new JSONObject(jsonString);
String name = jsonObject.getString("name");

But this doesn't work. I have also tried using the following code:

JSONObject jsonObject = new JSONObject(jsonString);
String name = jsonObject.get("name");

But this also doesn't work.

Please could someone help me with this?
Please using this api: JSONObject.getString("name").
Answer:<<<api>>>: JSONObject.getString("name")
<<<code>>>: String name = jsonObject.getString("name");
<<<explanation>>>: You're using the wrong method. You need to use get("name").
